phenomenon.name: Tote-Road Shagamaw

description.summary: The Tote-Road Shagamaw is one of the most anatomically absurd fearsome critters.
description.full: The Tote-Road Shagamaw is one of the most anatomically absurd fearsome critters. This impossible hybrid has the front half of a moose—including head, shoulders, and front hooved legs—seamlessly joined to the rear half of a bear, complete with hindquarters and pawed hind legs. According to lumberjack tall tales, this bizarre configuration is perfectly adapted for traveling along tote roads (logging roads used to haul supplies). The moose front handles one type of terrain while the bear rear handles another, creating an awkward but supposedly functional gait.

taxonomy.type: of terrain while the bear rear handles another, creating an awkward but supposedly functional gait.
